Title: Procurement Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: Remote Philippines · Philippines 2 weeks ago · 221 applicants
JobDetails: PHP480,000/yr - PHP540,000/yr Remote Full-time Entry level
JobDescription:
About the job
Remote Philippines

We are all about you, and that is the most important thing you need to know about us. We help you build your offshore team as easily, cheaply, and adaptable as possible.

We make an investment by working with you and your organization to develop a solution, locating the best employees with the best capabilities who fit your company, and preparing and getting your offshore crew set up and familiarised with your operations.

While we are aware of the variables that might derail even the most well-planned offshore projects, we help you when you run into problems and support you.

The Role

You Will Be Responsible For

Provide comprehensive support to the Procurement Officer, focusing on business inventory needs, supplier engagement, and order cycle management.
Track all inbound shipments, comparing them against Purchase Order (PO) estimated time of departure (ETD), estimated time of arrival (ETA), and flag any variances to management in a daily email. Variances may include date, quantity, route, SKU, or price.
Review and report on stock ordered and inbound quantities and values, categorized by vendor and country.
Monitor stock levels, sales, and customer allocation, promptly identifying and reporting any variances to management.
Propose new purchase orders based on demand files and stocking rules.
 Review open purchase orders (POs), and communicate with suppliers to ensure orders are on track for execution within the agreed manufacturing window to support PO ETD.
Key in purchase orders on behalf of management for review and assessment.
 Validate POs against invoices, historical pricing, and resolve any discrepancies.
Validate proposed consumption data against sales history and previous trends, highlighting variances to management.
Review customs clearance processes and prepare arrival documentation for clearance prior to vessel berthing.
Manage stock allocation process per customer through daily reports and coordination with procurement and warehouse.
Generate reports on vendor spend and shipment status.
Report any identified issues promptly.
Update the Demand Plan with actual consumption data each month to ensure up-to-date plans.
Maintain and update data for monthly reporting of Weeks of Supply (WOS) per vendor and SKU.
Attend monthly Procurement review meetings.
Maintain a 90% DIFOT (Delivery In Full, On Time) performance from vendors.
Ensure 99% price compliance from vendors.
Identify inbound or vendor issues before they occur with an 80% success rate.
Fully track all ocean deliveries within two weeks.
Achieve self-sufficiency in managing inbound shipments and supplier engagements within six weeks.
Track and report Weeks of Supply (WOS) information per vendor and SKU within six weeks.

Ideal Profile

You have at least 3 years experience, ideally within a Buying / Procurement or Data Analyst role.
You possess excellent negotiating skills with a strong ability to influence people of all levels.
You have good presentation and communication skills and the ability to present you findings clearly and accessibly in the form of reports and presentations to senior colleagues.
You have working knowledge of Excel Formulas, Big Data Analytics and Procurement
You are a strong networker & relationship builder
You pay strong attention to detail and deliver work that is of a high standard
You are highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments
Proven experience in procurement support or a similar role within a fast-paced environment.
Exceptional proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced data manipulation using formulas and pivot tables.
Quick learner with the ability to adapt to new IT systems efficiently.
Familiarity with track and trace systems for obtaining information on international shipping.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for effective collaboration and problem-solving.
Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and quality in all tasks.
Ability to follow repetitive processes consistently and efficiently.
Analytical mindset with a passion for identifying variances and resolving issues.
Ability to communicate confidently and effectively in challenging conversations.

What's on Offer?

Opportunity within a company with a solid track record of performance
Join a market leader within Transport & Logistics
A role that offers a breadth of learning opportunities

Title: Threat Intelligence Analyst
CompanyDetails: ActiveFence · Metro Manila 2 weeks ago · 28 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
As a Threat Analyst, Intelligence Desk at ActiveFence, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the safety and security of our client platforms’ users and digital assets. You will focus on identifying and analyzing cyber threats and attacks, and working to understand the tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) of threat actors. This will involve conducting in-depth investigations to track down the sources of malicious activity, and engaging in red-team activities to test and improve our clients' defenses or policies.

Your work may require you to build new intelligence models that are tailored to the specific needs of our clients. To excel in this role, you must be able to balance multiple projects simultaneously, work well under pressure, and demonstrate a keen eye for detail. You will be working in a highly technical environment that requires a deep understanding of cybersecurity principles and practices.

Responsibilities:

Identifying and analyzing Trust and Safety risks and cyber threats and attacks, including but not limited to fraud, phishing, malware, and social engineering tactics.
Conducting in-depth investigations to track down the sources of malicious activity and to gather intelligence on threat actors.
Engaging in red-team activities to test and improve our clients' defenses against cyber attacks.
Building new intelligence models that are tailored to the specific needs of our clients.
Collaborating with other members of the team to share information and insights on cyber threats and attacks.

Requirements:

Skills & Qualifications

Fluent in English or a native speaker -must
Additional language speaker- advantage
Extensive experience in web intelligence (WEBINT) and open-source intelligence (OSINT).
Fundamental knowledge of dark web investigation and source collection, as well as network, DNS, and web security.
Strong analytical skills, with a methodological approach to analyzing and interpreting online data.
A background in Python or data analysis is an advantage.
Proactive and independent, with a can-do attitude.
Able to work effectively in a fast-paced and highly technical environment.
Curious and motivated, with a passion for learning new things.
Excellent attention to detail.
Quick learner of new practice areas and technological tools.
Proficient in Excel/Google Sheets.
Capable of dealing with harsh content at times.
Full-time availability is a must.

About ActiveFence:

ActiveFence is the leading tool stack for Trust & Safety teams, worldwide. By relying on ActiveFence’s end-to-end solution, Trust & Safety teams – of all sizes – can keep users safe from the widest spectrum of online harms, unwanted content, and malicious behavior, including child safety, disinformation, fraud, hate speech, terror, nudity, and more.

Using cutting-edge AI and a team of world-class subject-matter experts to continuously collect, analyze, and contextualize data, ActiveFence ensures that in an ever-changing world, customers are always two steps ahead of bad actors. As a result, Trust & Safety teams can be proactive and provide maximum protection to users across a multitude of abuse areas, in 70+ languages.

Backed by leading Silicon Valley investors such as CRV and Norwest, ActiveFence has raised $100M to date; employs 300 people worldwide, and has contributed to the online safety of billions of users across the globe.

Title: Content Data Analyst
CompanyDetails: Rimes · Metro Manila 1 week ago · 7 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
Rimes provides transformative data management, ESG and investment intelligence solutions to the global investment community. Driven by our passion for solving the most complex data problems, we partner with our clients to help them make better investment decisions using accurate information and industry-leading technology. Headquartered in New York and London, Rimes serves its global clients through offices in Europe, Americas and Asia Pacific.

We are currently in the midst of an exciting growth phase, as Rimes extends into new markets and geographies. To support this, we are hiring for roles across Sales, Product, Development, Marketing and other functions. Visit our Careers page to see our complete listings and more information on our competitive benefits package.

Content & Permissions

The Content & Permissions team acts as the gatekeeper for all third-party communications with Rimes' 800 information providers on behalf of our 400 end clients. The team manages key relationships with a huge and varied international group of information providers.

The Content Data Analyst's role is vital to the Rimes infrastructure, they ensure that Rimes' end clients are able to access a complete catalogue of benchmark data with the most accurate regulatory information and index identifiers. The Content Data Analyst is responsible for identifying and correcting data gaps impacting our Foundational Data products, connecting with team members and other departments to seek information and prioritize issues meaningfully. During the process, it is the Content Data Analyst's responsibility to ensure that Rimes' users are kept informed on the progress of any escalated issues.

The role requires a technically-oriented person, someone who enjoys sticking to issues until they are fully resolved and uses creative thinking to find simple solutions. The candidate must be able to work on multiple projects at the same time and be proactive in the validation of work completed. The ideal candidate for this role must also be able to demonstrate a good understanding of index data and a degree of experience in data analysis (using advanced excel functionalities and ideally Python).

Other desirable qualities include proficiency in the use of Rimes excel add-in tools.

You are:

Analytically minded and a structured thinker
A problem solver
Technologically oriented, but also aware of the need for appropriate processes and procedures
Able to multi-task, prioritize and meet deadlines
Attentive to detail, but also able to demonstrate a wide degree of creativity 
Happy to work on your own initiative
A confident communicator with exceptional organizational skills
Flexible, enthusiastic and display a positive attitude

Areas of Responsibility:

Support the suite of Rimes Foundational Data
Identify, analyze and resolve meta data gaps, creating new data content and mapping records across databases
Supporting the maintenance and growth of the Rimes index catalogue, adding new records, and maintaining database integrity
Proactively maintain and keep up-to-date documentation of processes and procedures and communicate changes to the wider team
Identify areas of improvement in existing processes and collaborate with team members to achieve greater efficiency and scalability

Qualifications, Skills & Experience Required:

Understanding of globally recognized identifiers used in the financial markets for recognition and identification of tradable securities, such as SEDOL, ISIN, CUSIP, OpenFIGI and Exchange Tickers
Strong communication, interpersonal and organizational skills
High proficiency with MS Excel®
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously under tight deadlines
Ability to work within a team as well as independently
Desire to learn new technology and grow in an ever-changing environment
Experience working with, querying, and manipulating large datasets
Fluency in English

Also useful:

Sound working knowledge of financial spreadsheets and financial databases and applications
Knowledge and understanding of equity and fixed income indices
Familiarity with financial regulations, such as Benchmark Regulation (BMR), MiFID II and MAR
Fluency in more than one foreign language is beneficial to a career at Rimes
Basic knowledge of Python and SQL

Rimes is committed to promote the values of diversity and inclusion throughout the business. Whether it's through recruitment, retention, career progression or training and development, we are committed to improving opportunities for people regardless of their background or circumstances.

Warehouse Team and Procurement Team and demonstrate proficiency in Excel and IT systems to

effectively gather, analyse and interpret data.

Key Responsibilities

 Provide comprehensive support to the Procurement Officer, focusing on business

inventory needs, supplier engagement, and order cycle management.

 Track all inbound shipments, comparing them against Purchase Order (PO) estimated

time of departure (ETD), estimated time of arrival (ETA), and flag any variances to

management in a daily email. Variances may include date, quantity, route, SKU, or price.

 Review and report on stock ordered and inbound quantities and values, categorized by

vendor and country.

 Monitor stock levels, sales, and customer allocation, promptly identifying and reporting

any variances to management.

 Propose new purchase orders based on demand files and stocking rules.
 Review open purchase orders (POs), communicate with suppliers to ensure orders are on

track for execution within the agreed manufacturing window to support PO ETD.

 Key in purchase orders on behalf of management for review and assessment.
 Validate POs against invoices, historical pricing, and resolve any discrepancies.
 Validate proposed consumption data against sales history and previous trends,

highlighting variances to management.

 Review customs clearance processes and prepare arrival documentation for clearance

prior to vessel berthing.

 Manage stock allocation process per customer through daily reports and coordination

with procurement and warehouse.

Monthly Tasks

 Generate reports on vendor spend and shipment status.
 Report any identified issues promptly.
 Update the Demand Plan with actual consumption data each month to ensure

up-to-date plans.

 Maintain and update data for monthly reporting of Weeks of Supply (WOS) per vendor

and SKU.

 Attend monthly Procurement review meetings.

Key Skills

 Proven experience in procurement support or a similar role within a fast-paced

environment.

 Exceptional proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced data manipulation using

formulas and pivot tables.

 Quick learner with the ability to adapt to new IT systems efficiently.
 Familiarity with track and trace systems for obtaining information on international

shipping.

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills for effective collaboration and

problem-solving.

 Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and quality in all tasks.
 Ability to follow repetitive processes consistently and efficiently.
 Analytical mindset with a passion for identifying variances and resolving issues.
 Ability to communicate confidently and effectively in challenging conversations.
 Demonstrated ability to communicate problems and escalate issues to management.

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

 Maintain a 90% DIFOT (Delivery In Full, On Time) performance from vendors.
 Ensure 99% price compliance from vendors.
 Identify inbound or vendor issues before they occur with an 80% success rate.
 Fully track all ocean deliveries within two weeks.
 Achieve self-sufficiency in managing inbound shipments and supplier engagements

within six weeks.

 Track and report Weeks of Supply (WOS) information per vendor and SKU within six

weeks.

 Key in all purchase orders within ten weeks

Title: Analyst, Human Intelligence, Crisp
CompanyDetails: Kroll · Manila, National Capital Region, Philippines 1 week ago · 11 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
In a world of disruption and increasingly complex business challenges, our professionals bring truth into focus with the Kroll Lens. Our sharp analytical skills, paired with the latest technology, allow us to give our clients clarity—not just answers—in all areas of business. We embrace diverse backgrounds and global perspectives, and we cultivate diversity by respecting, including, and valuing one another. As part of One team, One Kroll, you’ll contribute to a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel.

Would you like a role which makes a real world impact? The protection of children and vulnerable users has been a fundamental part of Crisp’s mission since the company was formed; we are now looking for a talented and committed individual to join our Human Intelligence team in Leeds to look for online threats across a number of high risk areas such as Child Endangerment, Violent Extremism, Suicide & Self Harm and Graphic Violence. Our intelligence makes a huge difference; every year we protect millions of the most vulnerable from the most egregious forms of exploitation.

There will be some weekend working in this role, so flexibility around working hours is a must.

At Kroll, your work will help deliver clarity to our clients’ most complex governance, risk, and transparency challenges. Apply now to join One team, One Kroll.

Requirements;

We need someone who is a keen problem solver, with a highly inquisitive nature.
You should be open to regular discussions about how something is done, why it is happening and where to look to find more.
You should have a genuine interest in researching the topics, be proactive in finding the problems before they become a real crisis for platforms, users and advertisers. Preferably, you should understand / know how to research the ‘dark side’ of the web to flag up the content and know how to use complex search engine phrases and be very familiar with all social platforms available.
You will also have subject-matter expertise within this specific threat or a closely related field - such as, but not limited to, policing or military service.
You will have expertise in intelligence gathering within formal environments and producing reports for immediate action.

Essential Experience;

A degree level qualification or equivalent experience.
Significant experience in a related role, or similar experience.
A background in law enforcement, intelligence, charity or NGO, online safety, or similar.
Great communicator, able to write pithily and with impact, and able to influence others.
Experience of team leadership, including successfully leading a virtual team.

It would be highly desirable if candidates could speak one of the following languages; Korean, Turkish or Japanese.

In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com.

Kroll is committed to equal opportunity and diversity, and recruits people based on merit.

JobDescription:
About the job
IT Data Analyst (Dayshift, Australian, WFH)

Job Summary

We are seeking a tech-savvy individual with a keen interest in working as an IT/Data Analyst for our strata management company. We are forming a new team headed up ‘Strategic Technology & Analytics Team’ to focus on leveraging existing technology stacks to improve operational efficiency and enhanced client experience.

The primary goal of this role is to act as a catalyst in our digital transformation journey. The successful recruit will work on a variety of tasks ranging from data analysis and reporting to application development, with an emphasis on leveraging existing automation processes and generating actionable insights. This role is pivotal in helping the company transition into a more data-driven and technologically agile organisation, thereby not only streamlining internal operations but also elevating the client experience through transparent and insightful reporting capabilities.

In order to excel in this role, you will need to be able to assist with the preparation of data analysis reports using Microsoft Power BI and other industry applications, along with integration and data synchronisation of tasks relative to various industry platforms and applications.

Furthermore, strong communication skills and the ability to stay updated with Python Data manipulation and processes involving control API integration changes are essential. Exceptional analytical skills will also be crucial in analyzing data and software performance and optimizing strategies accordingly.

If you believe you are up for the challenge of being an IT/Data Analyst in the property management industry, specialized in strata management and its corresponding fields, we encourage you to reach out to us. We are excited to potentially work together.

Responsibilities

Assist with the preparation of data analysis reports using Microsoft Power BI and other industry applications (standard tools) and tsk management software.
Support the development and maintenance of basic enterprise applications.
Work on data manipulation and analysis tasks using Python or similar languages.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand specific project requirements and deliverables.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting for existing systems and platforms currently deployed.
Assist with the integration and data synchronisation of tasks relative to various industry platforms and applications.
Work on ad-hoc IT projects as directed by the management or the Executive team.
Manage and control API integrations to improve and streamline company functionality.
Maintain confidentiality.

Qualifications

At least 2 years of proven experience in data analysis, including Microsoft Power BI reporting.
Skilled with enterprise applications and development.
Basic to intermediate Python programming skills.
Strong understanding of IT systems and data management having regard for data security.
Experience with API integrations and across a number of different applications.
Ability to adapt to different industry software platforms and applications.
Experience with task management systems (e.g., Slack, Asana, ClickUp) and establishing automation tools (e.g., JotForm) is desirable.
Familiarity with chatbot technologies. 
Ability to work independently and contribute to a team environment.
Maintain strong communication skills, both written and oral.

Benefits

Healthy, conducive work environment(Great Place to WorkTM – Certified two years in a row!)
Competitive salary
21 leave credits + all client-based holidays
100% paid on non-special working holidays rather than 30% 
De Minimis/ Allowances(upon regularization) 
HMO coverage + dependent
Lots of opportunities to enhance your skills, acquire new experiences, work among experts, and grow your career.
Exposure to world-class, high-level management from local and international direct supervisors.

Title: BI Analyst
CompanyDetails: Concentrix · Makati, National Capital Region, Philippines Reposted 1 week ago · 71 applicants
JobDescription:
About the job
Job Title:

BI Analyst

Job Description

Imagine being able to partner with global technology leaders in a company that cares about YOU – your professional growth, your success, and your community.

We are looking for a BI Analyst to join our team. Today.

The future team member that will lead our decisions for customers and partners by developing and providing data through data analysis and by creating reports of patterns, insights and trends. Reporting to the Manager of Business Intelligence, You will mine data from a variety of data resources to design impact recommendations to our partners. The Business Intelligence Analyst will create specifications for reports and analysis based on in-depth assessment and understanding of our needs and data available. Along the way you will have access to excellent training opportunities to grow and enhance your skills and career. At Concentrix, you can truly Own Your Future!

You Have:

Proficient knowledge of expanded analysis tools (such as OLTP/OLAP data structures, Advanced Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets), Tableau, Salesforce, Power BI, Business Objects)
Proficient knowledge of domain languages (such as SQL Query, HIVE QL)
Apply moderately complex statistical methods (such as deviations, quartiles)
2–5 years of related experience to reflect skills and talent necessary for this role
Practical sales motion knowledge
Practical industry and demographic understanding in one of the following: (hardware, software, SaaS, healthcare or industrial)
Proficiency in all Microsoft products especially Word, Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets) and PowerPoint
Bachelor's Degree of Diploma in computer science, finance or statistics/mathematics
4+ years' experience in data-driven business insight recommendations, business analytics, dashboard design experience

You will:

Interpret moderately complex goals, trends, risks and areas for improvement by collecting, analyzing and reporting on key metrics and conclusions. May maintain integrity of reports and dashboards to allow business to operate
Use expanded solutions and knowledge to support customer teams and increase efficiency. Work on projects/matters of moderate complexity in an independent contributor role.
Work and builds internal and external relationships to ensure high-quality data is available for analysis and better understanding
Develop data-driven insights to all partners
Engage daily with partners for planning, forecasting and gaining an understanding of questions for appropriate documentation and analysis
Work well independently and will seek counsel and guidance on more complex projects/matters. Work is generally reliable on routine tasks

Our Benefits/Perks:

Health Insurance with Dental Coverage for Employees – extended to two (2 dependents)
Paid Time off
Birthday Time Off
Bereavement Leave
Life Insurance
Group Personal Accident Program
Employee Assistance Program
Volunteer Time Off, paid time yearly to volunteer with an organisation of your choice.
Rewards and recognition programs
Wellness Incentive Program
Learning and Development Programs

Accommodation Statement:

We have always been and will always be committed to the principle that everyone at Concentrix, regardless of who they are, where they hail from, the color of their skin, who they worship, or who they love, has equal opportunity, with policies and values which codify this, across all the countries where we are based. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic.

Virtual First and Remote Work:

Concentrix is a Virtual First company, which means work outside of an office will be the primary experience for most employees for the foreseeable future. Equipment will be provided, but Internet connection and a space at home to work is required. While you can work from your home, we do require that you are in a commutable distance (NCR, Cavite, Rizal, Laguna and Bulacan), of the local office to ensure you can attend when/if required by the company. In addition, per PEZA regulations, we are mandated to keep track and record the movement of all company-owned work equipment, thus any movement of these work equipment are prohibited without any prior approval by the management team, including our PH Site Director

PHL Makati City - Ayala North Exchange

English (Required)

Full time

Team Performance:
